segment.source: Respond to mouse input in your apps by handling the same basic pointer events that you use for touch and pen input.
segment.target: Respond to mouse input in your apps by handling the same basic pointer events that you use for touch and pen input.

segment.source: Mouse interactions
segment.target: Mouse interactions

segment.source: Mouse interactions
segment.target: Mouse interactions

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Optimize your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app design for touch input and get basic mouse support by default.
segment.target: Optimize your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app design for touch input and get basic mouse support by default.

segment.source: mouse
segment.target: mouse

segment.source: Mouse input is best suited for user interactions that require precision when pointing and clicking.
segment.target: Mouse input is best suited for user interactions that require precision when pointing and clicking.

segment.source: This inherent precision is naturally supported by the UI of Windows, which is optimized for the imprecise nature of touch.
segment.target: This inherent precision is naturally supported by the UI of Windows, which is optimized for the imprecise nature of touch.

segment.source: Where mouse and touch input diverge is the ability for touch to more closely emulate the direct manipulation of UI elements through physical gestures performed directly on those objects (such as swiping, sliding, dragging, rotating, and so on).
segment.target: Where mouse and touch input diverge is the ability for touch to more closely emulate the direct manipulation of UI elements through physical gestures performed directly on those objects (such as swiping, sliding, dragging, rotating, and so on).

segment.source: Manipulations with a mouse typically require some other UI affordance, such as the use of handles to resize or rotate an object.
segment.target: Manipulations with a mouse typically require some other UI affordance, such as the use of handles to resize or rotate an object.

segment.source: This topic describes design considerations for mouse interactions.
segment.target: This topic describes design considerations for mouse interactions.

segment.source: The UWP app mouse language
segment.target: The UWP app mouse language

segment.source: A concise set of mouse interactions are used consistently throughout the system.
segment.target: A concise set of mouse interactions are used consistently throughout the system.

segment.source: Term
segment.target: Term

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Hover to learn
segment.target: Hover to learn

segment.source: Hover over an element to display more detailed info or teaching visuals (such as a tooltip) without a commitment to an action.
segment.target: Hover over an element to display more detailed info or teaching visuals (such as a tooltip) without a commitment to an action.

segment.source: Left-click for primary action
segment.target: Left-click for primary action

segment.source: Left-click an element to invoke its primary action (such as launching an app or executing a command).
segment.target: Left-click an element to invoke its primary action (such as launching an app or executing a command).

segment.source: Scroll to change view
segment.target: Scroll to change view

segment.source: Display scroll bars to move up, down, left, and right within a content area.
segment.target: Display scroll bars to move up, down, left, and right within a content area.

segment.source: Users can scroll by clicking scroll bars or rotating the mouse wheel.
segment.target: Users can scroll by clicking scroll bars or rotating the mouse wheel.

segment.source: Scroll bars can indicate the location of the current view within the content area (panning with touch displays a similar UI).
segment.target: Scroll bars can indicate the location of the current view within the content area (panning with touch displays a similar UI).

segment.source: Right-click to select and command
segment.target: Right-click to select and command

segment.source: Right-click to display the navigation bar (if available) and the app bar with global commands.
segment.target: Right-click to display the navigation bar (if available) and the app bar with global commands.

segment.source: Right-click an element to select it and display the app bar with contextual commands for the selected element.
segment.target: Right-click an element to select it and display the app bar with contextual commands for the selected element.

segment.source: Note Right-click to display a context menu if selection or app bar commands are not appropriate UI behaviors.
segment.target: Note Right-click to display a context menu if selection or app bar commands are not appropriate UI behaviors.

segment.source: But we strongly recommend that you use the app bar for all command behaviors.
segment.target: But we strongly recommend that you use the app bar for all command behaviors.

segment.source: UI commands to zoom
segment.target: UI commands to zoom

segment.source: Display UI commands in the app bar (such as + and -), or press Ctrl and rotate mouse wheel, to emulate pinch and stretch gestures for zooming.
segment.target: Display UI commands in the app bar (such as + and -), or press Ctrl and rotate mouse wheel, to emulate pinch and stretch gestures for zooming.

segment.source: UI commands to rotate
segment.target: UI commands to rotate

segment.source: Display UI commands in the app bar, or press Ctrl+Shift and rotate mouse wheel, to emulate the turn gesture for rotating.
segment.target: Display UI commands in the app bar, or press Ctrl+Shift and rotate mouse wheel, to emulate the turn gesture for rotating.

segment.source: Rotate the device itself to rotate the entire screen.
segment.target: Rotate the device itself to rotate the entire screen.

segment.source: Left-click and drag to rearrange
segment.target: Left-click and drag to rearrange

segment.source: Left-click and drag an element to move it.
segment.target: Left-click and drag an element to move it.

segment.source: Left-click and drag to select text
segment.target: Left-click and drag to select text

segment.source: Left-click within selectable text and drag to select it.
segment.target: Left-click within selectable text and drag to select it.

segment.source: Double-click to select a word.
segment.target: Double-click to select a word.

segment.source: Mouse events
segment.target: Mouse events

segment.source: Respond to mouse input in your apps by handling the same basic pointer events that you use for touch and pen input.
segment.target: Respond to mouse input in your apps by handling the same basic pointer events that you use for touch and pen input.

segment.source: Use UIElement events to implement basic input functionality without having to write code for each pointer input device.
segment.target: Use UIElement events to implement basic input functionality without having to write code for each pointer input device.

segment.source: However, you can still take advantage of the special capabilities of each device (such as mouse wheel events) using the pointer, gesture, and manipulation events of this object.
segment.target: However, you can still take advantage of the special capabilities of each device (such as mouse wheel events) using the pointer, gesture, and manipulation events of this object.

segment.source: Samples: See this functionality in action in our app samples.
segment.target: Samples: See this functionality in action in our app samples.

segment.source: Input: Device capabilities sample
segment.target: Input: Device capabilities sample

segment.source: Input sample
segment.target: Input sample

segment.source: Input: Gestures and manipulations with GestureRecognizer
segment.target: Input: Gestures and manipulations with GestureRecognizer

segment.source: Guidelines for visual feedback
segment.target: Guidelines for visual feedback

segment.source: When a mouse is detected (through move or hover events), show mouse-specific UI to indicate functionality exposed by the element.
segment.target: When a mouse is detected (through move or hover events), show mouse-specific UI to indicate functionality exposed by the element.

segment.source: If the mouse doesn't move for a certain amount of time, or if the user initiates a touch interaction, make the mouse UI gradually fade away.
segment.target: If the mouse doesn't move for a certain amount of time, or if the user initiates a touch interaction, make the mouse UI gradually fade away.

segment.source: This keeps the UI clean and uncluttered.
segment.target: This keeps the UI clean and uncluttered.

segment.source: Don't use the cursor for hover feedback, the feedback provided by the element is sufficient (see Cursors below).
segment.target: Don't use the cursor for hover feedback, the feedback provided by the element is sufficient (see Cursors below).

segment.source: Don't display visual feedback if an element doesn't support interaction (such as static text).
segment.target: Don't display visual feedback if an element doesn't support interaction (such as static text).

segment.source: Don't use focus rectangles with mouse interactions.
segment.target: Don't use focus rectangles with mouse interactions.

segment.source: Reserve these for keyboard interactions.
segment.target: Reserve these for keyboard interactions.

segment.source: Display visual feedback concurrently for all elements that represent the same input target.
segment.target: Display visual feedback concurrently for all elements that represent the same input target.

segment.source: Provide buttons (such as + and -) for emulating touch-based manipulations such as panning, rotating, zooming, and so on.
segment.target: Provide buttons (such as + and -) for emulating touch-based manipulations such as panning, rotating, zooming, and so on.

segment.source: For more general guidance on visual feedback, see Guidelines for visual feedback.
segment.target: For more general guidance on visual feedback, see Guidelines for visual feedback.

segment.source: Cursors
segment.target: Cursors

segment.source: A set of standard cursors is available for a mouse pointer.
segment.target: A set of standard cursors is available for a mouse pointer.

segment.source: These are used to indicate the primary action of an element.
segment.target: These are used to indicate the primary action of an element.

segment.source: Each standard cursor has a corresponding default image associated with it.
segment.target: Each standard cursor has a corresponding default image associated with it.

segment.source: The user or an app can replace the default image associated with any standard cursor at any time.
segment.target: The user or an app can replace the default image associated with any standard cursor at any time.

segment.source: Specify a cursor image through the PointerCursor function.
segment.target: Specify a cursor image through the PointerCursor function.

segment.source: If you need to customize the mouse cursor:
segment.target: If you need to customize the mouse cursor:

segment.source: Always use the arrow cursor (
segment.target: Always use the arrow cursor (

segment.source: arrow cursor
segment.target: arrow cursor

segment.source: ) for clickable elements.
segment.target: ) for clickable elements.

segment.source: don't use the pointing hand cursor (
segment.target: don't use the pointing hand cursor (

segment.source: pointing hand cursor
segment.target: pointing hand cursor

segment.source: ) for links or other interactive elements.
segment.target: ) for links or other interactive elements.

segment.source: Instead, use hover effects (described earlier).
segment.target: Instead, use hover effects (described earlier).

segment.source: Use the text cursor (
segment.target: Use the text cursor (

segment.source: text cursor
segment.target: text cursor

segment.source: ) for selectable text.
segment.target: ) for selectable text.

segment.source: Use the move cursor (
segment.target: Use the move cursor (

segment.source: move cursor
segment.target: move cursor

segment.source: ) when moving is the primary action (such as dragging or cropping).
segment.target: ) when moving is the primary action (such as dragging or cropping).

segment.source: Don't use the move cursor for elements where the primary action is navigation (such as Start tiles).
segment.target: Don't use the move cursor for elements where the primary action is navigation (such as Start tiles).

segment.source: Use the horizontal, vertical and diagonal resize cursors (
segment.target: Use the horizontal, vertical and diagonal resize cursors (

segment.source: vertical resize cursor
segment.target: vertical resize cursor

segment.source: horizontal resize cursor
segment.target: horizontal resize cursor

segment.source: diagonal resize cursor (lower left, upper right)
segment.target: diagonal resize cursor (lower left, upper right)

segment.source: diagonal resize cursor (upper left, lower right)
segment.target: diagonal resize cursor (upper left, lower right)

segment.source: ), when an object is resizable.
segment.target: ), when an object is resizable.

segment.source: Use the grasping hand cursors (
segment.target: Use the grasping hand cursors (

segment.source: grasping hand cursor (open)
segment.target: grasping hand cursor (open)

segment.source: grasping hand cursor (closed)
segment.target: grasping hand cursor (closed)

segment.source: ) when panning content within a fixed canvas (such as a map).
segment.target: ) when panning content within a fixed canvas (such as a map).
